result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustyn M. Bahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Stephenson County, IL case #14CF163. May be served through Stephenson Co, IL Probation

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay court costs, crime victim witness surcharge and supervision fees through probation as determined by agent.

Defendant to make contact with AODA unit with Green County Human services to obtain information on Intoxicated driver intervention program. Defendant shall undergo treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate.

Dustyn M. Bahr, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Amended information filed. Defendant is pleading no contest to the amended charges. Plea Questionaire filed. Court advises defendant of rights. Elements stated. Factual basis found.
